means: <正>（尤指为表示礼貌或耐心而）克制，忍耐，容忍

sentence.Network_en: I forbear to go into details.
He forbear from take any further action.
sentence.Network_cn: 他克制自己不采取任何进一步的行动.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English forberan (see for-, bear). The original senses were 'endure, bear with', hence 'endure the absence of something, do without', also 'bear up against, control oneself', hence 'refrain from' (Middle English)

entry.def: If you forbear to do something, you do not do it although you have the opportunity or the right to do it.

example.ex: I forbore to comment on this...
example.tran: 我克制自己对此不予置评。

example.ex: Protesters largely forbore from stone-throwing and vandalism.
example.tran: 抗议者绝大多数没有投掷石头和蓄意破坏。

means.word_mean: 1. a person from whom you are descended

auth_sentence.content: Sarah could hardly forbear to cheer this triumph of co-operation over individualism.
